items.title: Class of 2027 - Biz Comm Weekend Logistics
items.html:
Class of 2027 - Biz Comm Weekend Logistics

Friday Jan 16 - Sunday Jan 18

  • Review the Biz Comm 2026 Event Schedule carefully.
    • Event check in begins at 8am PT
    • Plan to be in class for the full day as there will not be an opportunity to take outside meetings.
  • Please complete the Biz Comm 2026 Event Liability Waiver prior to check-in.
  • Important items to bring for Biz Comm 2026 include:
    • UC Berkeley Cal1 Card
    • Valid government ID (e.g., driver's license, passport)
    • Laptop or iPad with access to campus internet (eduroam or Cal Visitor)
  • Review the Biz Comm 2026 Email Archive.
  • If you require accommodation for effective communication (ASL interpreting/CART captioning, alternative media formats, etc.) or need information in order to fully participate for the weekend, please contact Robby Cortes.

items.title: Upcoming Program Office Hours
items.html:
Upcoming Program Office Hours

  • Thursday, Jan 15 - Program Office will be closed at 6PM.
    • Due to preparation for Biz Comm, there will not be late night hours or snacks from 7:30PM to 8PM
  • Friday, Jan 16: Program Office staff will be at Biz Comm; please expect a delayed response.
  • Monday, Jan 19: Closed for MLK Jr. Holiday.

items.title: MLK Day of Service
items.html:
MLK Day of Service

Monday, January 19th, 9:30AM - 11:30AM, UNITY Park / Richmond Greenway Trail, Richmond, CA

  • In celebration of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day, all members of the Haas community are invited for a day of community service and celebration.
    • Martin Luther King Jr. Day honors Dr. King's life, legacy, and aspiration of a beloved community marked by racial unity, justice for the betterment of all, and going beyond yourself
    Registration for MLK Day of Service 2026 is now open.
  • If you have further questions, please contact Katrina Koski, Dir of Inclusion & Belonging.

items.title: Class of 2026 & 2027
items.html:
Class of 2026 & 2027

Spring 2026 Add/Drop Reminders

  • Add/Drop Round 3: Tuesday, Jan 20, 12 noon PST - Monday, Jan 26, 12 noon PST.
  • Add/Drop Round 4: Monday, Jan 26, 4PM PST - Thursday, Jan 29, 12 noon PST.

  • Nexus and Lux will have a combined cohort for Macroeconomics.

Course Start Dates:

  • Flex core courses will start on Jan 20
  • Elective courses will begin on Jan 20

  • Please check the Academic Calendar, as well as your course descriptions for more details

items.title: Dean’s Speaker Series: Cynt Marshall, BS' 81
items.html:
Dean’s Speaker Series: Cynt Marshall, BS' 81

Thursday, Feb 5, 12:30PM PST, Spieker Forum

  • Please join Berkeley Haas for a Dean’s Speaker Series with Cynt Marshall.
    • Cynt is the President & CEO of Marshalling Resources, and is the Former CEO, Dallas Mavericks
  • Be on the lookout for future communications regarding registration for this Dean's Speaker Series Event.

items.title: Berkeley StEP Spring 2026 Application Now Open
items.html:
Berkeley StEP Spring 2026 Application Now Open

Deadline to apply is Feb 7, 2026 at 11:50PM PST

  • StEP was developed by former students to create the next generation of UC Berkeley startups.
  • During this 10-week experiential program, you will:
    • Connect with PhDs in engineering and computer science, MBAs, designers, law students
    • Network with top-notch experts that will help you in bringing your ideas to life
    • Access to 5k in in-kind perks & up to 1k in prizes
    • Opportunities to pitch to VCs and Industry leaders
  • The application for Berkeley StEP Spring 2026 is now available.

items.title: Berkeley StEP Spring 2026 Virtual Info Sessions
items.html:
Berkeley StEP Spring 2026 Virtual Info Sessions

  • Sign up for a virtual info session to learn more about StEP program and application process.
  • The dates and respective signup links are as follows:
    • StEP Spring 2026 Virtual Info Session on Monday, Jan 19, 2PM - 3PM PST
    • StEP Spring 2026 Virtual Info Session on Wednesday, Jan 21, 2PM - 3PM PST
    • StEP Spring 2026 Virtual Info Session on Monday, Jan 26, 12PM - 1PM PST
    • StEP Spring 2026 Virtual Info Session on Thursday, Jan 29, 4PM - 5PM PST

items.title: Haas SHARE@Haas Food Recovery Program: Join the Community Listserv
items.html:
Haas SHARE@Haas Food Recovery Program: Join the Community Listserv

  • Haas has launched the SHARE@Haas (Sustainable, Holistic, Accessible, Recoverable & Equitable) program, an initiative deeply committed to sustainability, zero waste, and addressing food insecurity within our community.
    • Due to the many events that Haas hosts, it is common to have excess food that is yummy and nutritious
  • In addition to our regular food donations to the Dorothy Day House, we have created an anonymous mailing list that is open to all members of the Haas community.
    • By opting into the list, emails will be sent to you whenever there is excess food available and where to access it free of charge for as long as supplies last
    • To be added to the mailing list, please sign up for the for listserv via the Haas Food Recovery Listserv Opt-in Google Form.
  • The SHARE@Haas Space is located in Cheit C128.
    • Please bring your CAL ID Card to access the room
    • There is also a Wonderfil Station; please check out the video for more information
  • Please reach out to Danner Doud Martin should any questions or suggestions arise
  • For more comprehensive food and other basic needs resources, please contact the Basic Needs Center

items.title: Planning Ahead for Spring 2026 Fees
items.html:
Planning Ahead for Spring 2026 Fees

How to Calculate the Spring 2026 Fees

  • The all inclusive per unit fee for 2025-2026 is $3,972. Multiply that by the number of units you will be taking to calculate your total tuition.
  • Spring 2026 tuition will be due Friday, Jan 16. At least 20% is due at that time to avoid late fees.
  • Enrollment in the Fee Payment Plan is per semester, not per year. Students must enroll in the plan again for Spring 2026.

Setting up your Direct Deposit Account

  • A Direct Deposit Electronic Funds Transfer Account is the easiest way to get refunds or other payments.
  • Go to CalCentral > My Finances > Financial Resources > Billing & Payments > Direct Deposit. Complete the steps to set up your account.

1098-T Form

  • Students will receive notification that their 1098-T form is read by the end of Jan 2026. More information here on the Student Billing website.

blue.title: Teams@Haas Check-In  Workshop #1 (Executive Coach) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
blue.description:
A critical component of effective teamwork is reflexivity (Schippers et al., 2003).  Reflexivity is a group's ability to collectively reflect upon team objectives, strategies, and processes and to adapt them accordingly. This is our primary goal for the Teams@Haas Team Check-in Workshop. 

Your teams will have the opportunity to engage in this practice during the Teams@Haas Team Check-In facilitated by a Teams@Haas Executive Coaching Team.  The goal of these workshops is to provide you and your team with a new set of tools and to also support you in facilitating a conversation for your team to step back and reflect on what is working well and where you might make adaptations for improved effectiveness.

Prior to the Team Check-In Workshop, please:

* Check Your Team's Workshop Time (no Berkeley time) & Location

* Review your Team Collaborative Plan 

* Watch: [HIT Team Check-In Plenary Video] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1535656/pages/video-team-check-in)

Participation Grade: Attendance for this session is part of your Leading People participation grade.

This Week's Materials: https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1545360/external_tools/79374

blue.title: Team Preferences for Case Preparation & Leadership Assignment
blue.description:
We will be using several cases to illustrate key marketing concepts this semester and deepen your understanding of the real-world business situations where marketers apply them. All of the cases are in the Study.Net reader. All are required reading and students should be prepared to discuss them in class.

This is your chance to decide as a team which case you want to focus on for the Case Preparation & Leadership Assignment. Two teams will be responsible for: (1) leading the class discussion of the key issues in the case, (2) writing a 3 page recap of their findings and recommendations, and (3) posting and monitoring a discussion board thread about the aspect of the case they are focusing on. One team will tackle the case from a company/competitive perspective and the other from a customer/consumer point of view.

Click here (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfAx2ONcz6CF1ghWfKD8t6iBEygSTZaikBwqak3Iy22MedhSg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=113674834595072819528) to see the questions to be addressed by the team responsible for our discussion of each case. Then, agree as a team on your top 3 choices and fill out this short preferences survey (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfAx2ONcz6CF1ghWfKD8t6iBEygSTZaikBwqak3Iy22MedhSg/viewform?usp=header). After submitting your response, have one team member upload the confirmation page to bCourses.

Teams will be assigned a case if they do not submit their preferences by Friday, Oct 17.

Due: Friday Oct 17 by 11:59pm
Points: 0
Available: Oct 8 at 12am - Oct 17 at 11:59pm

blue.title: Teams@Haas Check-In Workshop #2 (Self-Facilitated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
blue.description:
A critical component of effective teamwork is reflexivity (Schippers et al., 2003).  Reflexivity is a group's ability to collectively reflect upon team objectives, strategies, and processes and to adapt them accordingly. 

All academic teams are asked to complete a Self-Facilitated Team Check-In Workshop as they launch Fall B.  During this workshop, you will develop a Team Collaborative Map and ratify joint agreements to support your team in its next stage of development. 

Please identify one team member who will serve as the facilitator for this workshop and who will be responsible for uploading a photo of the Collaborative Map from the team's self-facilitated check-in. 

TEAM CHECK-IN #2 WORKSHOP SELF-FACILITATED LOGISTICS :

Timing: Schedule a team meeting and allow a minimum of 75 minutes (90 minutes preferred) to complete the process and ratify one or more joint agreements. 

Facilitation: Select one team member to serve as the facilitator. This person will be responsible for 1) preparing in advance by reviewing the process and objectives for each stage and pulling up the top three agreements from Check-In #1, 2) guiding the team through the entire workshop, 3) ensuring communication during the workshop is balanced (i.e., everyone has an opportunity to share and listen), 4) supporting the team in reaching 1-3 joint agreements in support of your team’s continued development and 5) uploading a photo of the Collaborative Map to bCourse by 10/24.  

Supplies:

* For an in-person check-in, teams will need a large whiteboard or easel pad, sticky notes, and markers. Kits with the needed supplies will be available in the MBA Lounge. Please return the kits to the lounge after using them so other teams can use them. 

* For a virtual check-in, teams can use the Zoom whiteboard function to create a collaborative map to support your brainstorming & discussion. 

Resources:

* [Check-In Video:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-check-in) Refresher on the purpose of a Team Check-In.

* [Self-Facilitated Check-In Deck:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053866?wrap=1) Provides detailed facilitation instructions

* [Note:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053931?wrap=1) An Overview of Giving and Receiving Reflective Feedback in Teams

Submission

* Photo of Collaborative Map with Team Agreements (1/team)

blue.title: Teams@Haas: Team Debrief Due (Blue)
blue.description:
Self-facilitated Team Debrief Workshop.

Submit: Photo of Team Journey Map + reflection paragraph.

Prompt options:
1. How did your team develop and what actions supported this?
2. What led to a team low point and how did you pivot?
3. Benefits/challenges of diverse team and leadership development?

Debrief Kit:
- Video overview
- Deck for process
- Supplies in MBA lounge or use Zoom whiteboard

blue.title: Teams@Haas Team Debrief (Self-Faciltiated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
blue.description:
At the end of your academic team journey, your team will be asked to self-facilitate a Team Debrief Workshop. 

Please identify one member of the team who is responsible for submitting a photo of your Team Journey Map and providing a reflection of your team journey based on one of the prompts outlined below that emerged in your discussions—no more than one paragraph required.  

Please select one of the prompts below and share your reflections:

* Please share one way your team developed either intentionally or unintentionally during your team journey, and what actions team members took to support this development? 

* Please share the conditions or actions that lead to a team's low point.  Was your team able to pivot and move out of this zone?  If so, what actions did the team take?   If not, why do you think this was the case?

* What were some of the benefits and challenges of working with a team of people from different disciplines, lived experiences, and cultures?  How did this contribute to the leadership development of the team members?

DEBRIEF KIT:

* [Video] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-debrief)Links to an external site. to provide an overview of the goals of the Team Debrief

* [] (https://prod.ally.ac/static/ally-icon-indicator-low-circle.b7cd3e0c1511a1080fd322790193604f.svg)[Deck] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053932?wrap=1) to take you through the process

* Supplies are available in the MBA lounge or draw your journey map using the zoom whiteboard function to support the conversation.

SUBMISSION:

* Identify one team member who will submit a photo of your team journey map and joint reflections.

gold.title: Teams@Haas Check-In  Workshop #1 (Executive Coach) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
gold.description:
A critical component of effective teamwork is reflexivity (Schippers et al., 2003).  Reflexivity is a group's ability to collectively reflect upon team objectives, strategies, and processes and to adapt them accordingly. This is our primary goal for the Teams@Haas Team Check-in Workshop. 

Your teams will have the opportunity to engage in this practice during the Teams@Haas Team Check-In facilitated by a Teams@Haas Executive Coaching Team.  The goal of these workshops is to provide you and your team with a new set of tools and to also support you in facilitating a conversation for your team to step back and reflect on what is working well and where you might make adaptations for improved effectiveness.

Prior to the Team Check-In Workshop, please:

* Check Your Team's Workshop Time (no Berkeley time) & Location

* Review your Team Collaborative Plan 

* Watch: [HIT Team Check-In Plenary Video] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1535656/pages/video-team-check-in)

Participation Grade: Attendance for this session is part of your Leading People participation grade.

gold.title: Team Preferences for Case Preparation & Leadership Assignment
gold.description:
We will be using several cases to illustrate key marketing concepts this semester and deepen your understanding of the real-world business situations where marketers apply them. All of the cases are in the Study.Net reader. All are required reading and students should be prepared to discuss them in class.

This is your chance to decide as a team which case you want to focus on for the Case Preparation & Leadership Assignment. Two teams will be responsible for: (1) leading the class discussion of the key issues in the case, (2) writing a 3 page recap of their findings and recommendations, and (3) posting and monitoring a discussion board thread about the aspect of the case they are focusing on. One team will tackle the case from a company/competitive perspective and the other from a customer/consumer point of view.

Click here (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfAx2ONcz6CF1ghWfKD8t6iBEygSTZaikBwqak3Iy22MedhSg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=113674834595072819528) to see the questions to be addressed by the team responsible for our discussion of each case. Then, agree as a team on your top 3 choices and fill out this short preferences survey (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfAx2ONcz6CF1ghWfKD8t6iBEygSTZaikBwqak3Iy22MedhSg/viewform?usp=header). After submitting your response, have one team member upload the confirmation page to bCourses.

Teams will be assigned a case if they do not submit their preferences by Friday, Oct 17.

Due: Friday Oct 17 by 11:59pm
Points: 0
Available: Oct 8 at 12am - Oct 17 at 11:59pm

gold.title: Teams@Haas Check-In Workshop #2 (Self-Facilitated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
gold.description:
A critical component of effective teamwork is reflexivity (Schippers et al., 2003).  Reflexivity is a group's ability to collectively reflect upon team objectives, strategies, and processes and to adapt them accordingly. 

All academic teams are asked to complete a Self-Facilitated Team Check-In Workshop as they launch Fall B.  During this workshop, you will develop a Team Collaborative Map and ratify joint agreements to support your team in its next stage of development. 

Please identify one team member who will serve as the facilitator for this workshop and who will be responsible for uploading a photo of the Collaborative Map from the team's self-facilitated check-in. 

TEAM CHECK-IN #2 WORKSHOP SELF-FACILITATED LOGISTICS :

Timing: Schedule a team meeting and allow a minimum of 75 minutes (90 minutes preferred) to complete the process and ratify one or more joint agreements. 

Facilitation: Select one team member to serve as the facilitator. This person will be responsible for 1) preparing in advance by reviewing the process and objectives for each stage and pulling up the top three agreements from Check-In #1, 2) guiding the team through the entire workshop, 3) ensuring communication during the workshop is balanced (i.e., everyone has an opportunity to share and listen), 4) supporting the team in reaching 1-3 joint agreements in support of your team’s continued development and 5) uploading a photo of the Collaborative Map to bCourse by 10/24.  

Supplies:

* For an in-person check-in, teams will need a large whiteboard or easel pad, sticky notes, and markers. Kits with the needed supplies will be available in the MBA Lounge. Please return the kits to the lounge after using them so other teams can use them. 

* For a virtual check-in, teams can use the Zoom whiteboard function to create a collaborative map to support your brainstorming & discussion. 

Resources:

* [Check-In Video:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-check-in) Refresher on the purpose of a Team Check-In.

* [Self-Facilitated Check-In Deck:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053866?wrap=1) Provides detailed facilitation instructions

* [Note:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053931?wrap=1) An Overview of Giving and Receiving Reflective Feedback in Teams

Submission

* Photo of Collaborative Map with Team Agreements (1/team)

- Video overview
- Deck for process
- Supplies in MBA lounge or use Zoom whiteboard

gold.title: Teams@Haas Team Debrief (Self-Faciltiated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
gold.description:
At the end of your academic team journey, your team will be asked to self-facilitate a Team Debrief Workshop. 

Please identify one member of the team who is responsible for submitting a photo of your Team Journey Map and providing a reflection of your team journey based on one of the prompts outlined below that emerged in your discussions—no more than one paragraph required.  

Please select one of the prompts below and share your reflections:

* Please share one way your team developed either intentionally or unintentionally during your team journey, and what actions team members took to support this development? 

* Please share the conditions or actions that lead to a team's low point.  Was your team able to pivot and move out of this zone?  If so, what actions did the team take?   If not, why do you think this was the case?

* What were some of the benefits and challenges of working with a team of people from different disciplines, lived experiences, and cultures?  How did this contribute to the leadership development of the team members?

DEBRIEF KIT:

* [Video] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-debrief)Links to an external site. to provide an overview of the goals of the Team Debrief

* [] (https://prod.ally.ac/static/ally-icon-indicator-low-circle.b7cd3e0c1511a1080fd322790193604f.svg)[Deck] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053932?wrap=1) to take you through the process

* Supplies are available in the MBA lounge or draw your journey map using the zoom whiteboard function to support the conversation.

SUBMISSION:

* Identify one team member who will submit a photo of your team journey map and joint reflections.

original.title: Class 8 - Group Facilitators Iggy's Case Memo (EWMBA 205 LEC 01A (In Person)) [EWMBA 205-LEC-01A & 02A FA25]
original.description:
Case: Iggy's Bread of the World

You are a board member/trusted advisor making recommendations to the Ivanovics regarding both McRae's proposal and the problems unfolding that the Ivanovics need to deal with to continue to be successful. Your recommendation (including points 1-3 below) should be in the form of a memo to Iggy + Ludmilla.  It should be one page maximum (single-spaced, 12-point font, Times New Roman, and 1-inch margins).

As a facilitator, you’ll use the preparation of this memo to help kick off and guide your group’s discussion. You won’t need to present your memo in full, but it should give you a clear point of view and framing to engage your teammates. Please remember: if you haven’t done the readings or submitted your memo, you won’t be equipped to lead your group and you’ll be letting your team down.

Iggy + Ludmilla want to see the following in your memo:

1. A clear and succinct understanding of the key challenges they face in the situation. Your support of the challenges should include case facts/observations.

2. The pros/cons of various alternatives available for addressing the challenges.

3. A strong rationale for your recommended action, based upon (1) and (2) above. Not only should your recommendation be supported based upon the facts of the case and your expert knowledge (the “why”), but also your recommendation should include the “who, what, when, and how”.

To support your thinking, reflect on these questions:

*

What values have the Ivanovics instilled in Iggy’s culture, and how have they used direct, indirect, and symbolic influence to shape it?

*

What’s at stake in their current conflict with McRae? What’s driving the breakdown?

*

What’s your assessment of McRae’s role? Could the situation be repaired, or should they move on? If so, what’s next?

Submission Details:

* Due: On bCourses by 6:00 PM on the day of class

*

Format: Type directly into the submission box

*

Grading: You will receive a grade out of 5 points based on the quality and effort demonstrated in your memo. See rubric posted below.

Good luck and have fun baking up a plan! 🥖

original.title: Team Assignment: Corporate Memo (Final Submission) [EWMBA 201A-LEC-01A & 02A FA25]
original.description:
Much of the work of business takes place in teams. To enhance your experience with teams and with your classmates, you will be asked to write a short memo analyzing a company’s cost structure and pricing policies. The details about this team assignment can be found below. You have to work on this assignment with the study group you have been assigned to.

Only one member per study group has to upload the PDF with the team's pricing project to bCourses. For more detailed instructions, read the following page:

[Pricing Project Directions] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1544880/pages/team-assignment-corporate-memo-instructions)

Note that this is your final submission and will be graded. Make sure you submitted the latest version of your group project.

launch.title: Launchathon Weekend — UC LAUNCH
launch.description: We are looking for talent across Berkeley to help our startups solve their business challenges. Join us at this two-day hackathon-styled event where you get paired with a UC LAUNCH startup and share your expertise. Prize money will be awarded by VC Judges to the top volunteers!

launch.title: UC LAUNCH Demo Day
launch.description:
Join us to watch the top startups pitch for a chance to win up to $60K in prizes. Winners are selected by our VC Judges.\
\
The day will be jam-packed with pitches, networking, and inspiration you won't want to miss!\
\
Registration opens in October.

campusGroups.title: 2025 Big Game Tailgate + Buses
campusGroups.location: Stanford Stadium, 625 Nelson Road, Stanford 94305, 2220 Piedmont Avenue, Berkeley, CA 94720, United States
campusGroups.description:
Time for the Big Game vs. Stanford! 

The Haas EWMBAA will be coordinating buses to Stanford, with a tailgate near Stanford GSB. Please mark if you will be attending the game with your own transportation or if you will be on one of the buses to the game, so we can get an accurate headcount for bus bookings. 

Bus pickup and drop-off information is:

Pickup Time: 1pm
BUS 1 Pickup: San Francisco City Hall 1 Dr Carlton B Goodlett Pl, San Francisco
BUS 2 Pickup: 2220 Piedmont Ave, Berkeley

Destination: Stanford Stadium, 625 Nelson Rd, Stanford

NOTE: Transportation is only TO the game at Stanford - post-game activities and transportation should be coordinated separately.

Tickets can be purchased at: https://tickets.gostanford.com/event/67f5e6e0d7f43d0fa292f0b1/68f289b1f1245cdfa4cd5403

Be sure to wear blue & gold!

GO BEARS!!!
Dress Code: Casual (jeans ok)
---
Event Details: https://haas.campusgroups.com/rsvp?id=2250936
